text: Etzer Vilaire Etzer Vilaire (7 April 1872 - 1951) was a Haitian poet and attorney. ==Early life and education== Born in Jérémie, Vilaire was educated in private schools. He attended law school and passed the bar. ==Career== Entering a law practice, he wrote poetry in his spare time but it was his true vocation. He was a member of the literary society La Ronde. ==Literary career== He published several books of poetry. His most remembered works are Page d'Amour (1897), Dix Hommes Noirs (1901), Années Tendres (1907), and Nouveaux Poèmes (1910). ==References== * Category:1872 births Category:1951 deaths Category:Haitian male poets Category:People from Grand'Anse (department) Category:Haitian lawyers Category:19th-century lawyers Category:19th-century Haitian poets Category:19th-century male writers Category:20th-century lawyers Category:20th-century Haitian poets Category:20th-century male writers
title: Etzer Vilaire
